title: Pure N Spiration
headline: Latter Day Saint  |  Husband  |  Father  |  Full-Stack Developer

foundationalRoles.text: Great pride, passion, and enthusiasm goes into each foundational role.  They each require of many things, and here are some of those things:

Be unafraid and enjoy tackling challenges.  Be comfortable with the unnown.  Collaborate before making bigger decisions.  Strive to make solid decisions with sometimes limited information.  Be accountable for any outcome of the aforementioned decisions.  Strive to be ready and willing to try new things to learn and grow.
Each of the aformentied skills, traits, or abilities are what is striven for by me every single day in my programming journey.  They are key to who I am.  Though, do not just take my word for it.

interestsText.text: If you want to discover the true character of a person, you have only to observe what they are passionate about.
interestsText.author: ~ Shannon L. Alder

projects.title: Pure N Spiration
description: Nathan Cluff's Purely Inspired Portfolio Website

projects.title: Hangman
description: The game of hangman.  Pick one letter at a time to see if you can guess a custom word or phrase.
projects.technologies: HTML5, CSS3, SCSS, JavaScript, Vue.js, Node.js, Express.js, JSON

projects.title: King Richard
description: A zero based budget made for everyone.
It is especially made to be adaptable to anyone in the world.  Hopefully, it also can be for anyone in any kind of circumstance.
projects.technologies: HTML5, CSS3, SCSS, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, JSON

posts.title: Starting A Project With VS Code

content.data: Welcome to my blog!  Whether you are new to the craft or not, the goal is to provide quality content.  Before starting into the technical details, I would love to share a couple of quotes that I recently came across which had hit home with me.
The secret of getting ahead is getting started. The secret of getting started is breaking your complex overwhelming tasks into small manageable tasks, and starting on the first one. ~ Mark Twain

The beginning of this quote hit home because anyone can overthink exactly what it takes to be a web or software developer, let alone anything.  Especially as things get going, it will start looking like a foreign language, but gradually, as you take one simple task at a time, you will begin to understand what you are doing more and more.
The only thing that stands between you and grand success in living are these two things: getting started and never quitting! ~ Robert H. Schuller

This one really hit home because as you understand more and more, you will at some point begin to understand there is lots you do not know that you do not know.  So..., something called 'impostor syndrome' could creep into your own thoughts and feelings.  So, just as important as getting started is the decision to NOT QUIT.  Eventually, things will become more comfortable in the not knowing, and little by little, you will begin to understand more of WHY things work the way they do, let alone HOW to do things.

So..., without further ado, let's get started. This post is about getting started on a project with VS Code. It is the code editor or IDE of choice for me, and of course I would recommend it greatly. However, you can use whatever editor of choice, but just so you are aware, some things that might work in VS Code from this post, might not work for the editor you choose. And, just just so you have the opportunity to give VS Code a test drive, you can download it right here.

There are at least a few ways to get started with a project that I know of, and some of them will be covered here.  The first is to use the 'GUI', or Graphical User Interface of your computer as well as VS Code.  At this point you have a choice between two different methods of utilizing your GUI.  The first is to give your mouse a right click on the desktop.  It will provide you with the options of creating a new folder or a new file, amongst other options.

altTexts: Creating A New Folder By Right Click On The Desktop.
Creating A New Document By Right Clicking On The Desktop.

content.data: The Second, is to open your file explorer, and click on File, which will present you with the option of creating a new folder or file where you currently are in your file system.

content.altText: Creating A New Folder Or Document Using File Explorer.

posts.author: Nathan Cluff

contact.text: Regardless of the message or feedback being positive, negative, or neutral, I hope you feel free to share it with me!
contact.shortText: Please feel free to get in touch!
